title: Helvetica-like font with complete unicode sets
content:
Hello,

I am looking for a decent alternative to Helvetica wich would have a solid complete unicode support: latin, central european, cyrillic, greek and turkish.

It must come as a single font file and I need light/regular/medium variants.

Any hints would be greatly appreciated...
author: monsieurfil

comments.content:
[Akzidenz Grotesk Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030225/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/790199.html) from Berthold

George Triantafyllakos - backpacker.gr

[Hypatia Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030225/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/hypatia.html)?  
<cite>As a greatly expanded and enhanced OpenType Pro family, Hypatia Sans Pro includes pan-European language coverage and a broad palette of weights.</cite>

1. Latin, CE, cyrillic, greek …? Yes!  
2. Helvetica-like? Well, it’s a sans … but certainly not a Swiss grotesque.  
3. But is it decent? Oh yes!

\> am looking for a decent alternative to Helvetica

What is it about Helvetica you don't like? Ubiquity, price, the name?

Cheers, Si
When you say Helvetica-like, do you mean a Swiss grotesque, or will any sans do? There are certainly dozens of sans with the language support and range of weights you're looking for.
Related thread: [Open Type Helvetica for all european languages?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030225/http:/typophile.com/node/19476)

Thanks everyone :)

Jongseong \> I mean a sans serif font wich will look similar enough to Helvetica Neue.  
It's for web use at less than 20pt.

sii \> I have nothing against or for Helvetica, please re-read my initial question.

Akzidenz Grotesk Pro seem to be a good match - Hypatia looks really nice but it has too much personality.

Thanks for the clarification. Too bad Univers doesn't have Greek, as far as I know.

[Swiss 721](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414030225/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/swiss-721/) would be a nice candidate, although it seems to support Cyrillic and Greek in only a few of its weights.

Will I get pelted with rotten tomatoes if I mention "Arial Unicode"? LOL!

[EDIT: re-read the question & saw requirement for other weights. Forget I spoke!]
